===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
''{{w|Shuowen}}'': {{Han compound|屮|毐|ls=ic}}.

===Etymology 1===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*duk ~ tuk||poison; to poison}}. Cognate with {{cog|bo|དུག||poison; toxin}}, {{m|bo|གདུག}}, {{m|bo|གདུག་པ||vicious; evil; poisonous}}, {{cog|my|တောက်||to suffer from toxicity; to be ill; to be poisonous}}.

A departing tone variant, meaning “to poison”, is preserved in Cantonese, Hakka and Min dialects. It is derived from the sense “poison” with the ''*–s'' suffix in Old Chinese.
